column4: ok guys now whatever i do in synaptic i get "subprocess new post-removal script returned error exit status 1"
Open a terminal and type "sudo apt-get install -f"
I would say there has been a clash in packages and it needs fixn
ok what package does it complain about
debconf: DbDriver "config": /var/cache/debconf/config.dat is locked by another process: Resource temporarily unavailable
i think i know what i did wrong
jeeze, now i get : phpgroupware: Package is in a very bad inconsistent state - you should and thats it
yu might need to remove then reinstall
i must purge my system of this unholy software
i think i ran in to problems when i chose remove completely for some reason
try sudo apt-get install --reinstall phpgroupware also maybe sudo apt-get install phpgroupware --fix-missing
yeah i reinstalled it and then just did a remove and it seemed to have gone off without a hitch this time
